column4: so quick question.. i was running ubuntu from livecd.. installed the packages for the broadcom controllers so i could connect to the internet, got to myspace and everything.. tried to install the package for xchat and it froze..

so quick question.. i was running ubuntu from livecd.. installed the packages for the broadcom controllers so i could connect to the internet, got to myspace and everything.. tried to install the package for xchat and it froze..
does it have something to do with my RAM?
and i know running from live cd takes up like 350k
probably has to do with your ram,  when you run the live cd you are infact running the entier os from your RAM  you donT' have that much space to play around
menu > system > admin > gnome partition editor
this channel is #ubuntu on the freenode network
check in the forum  there is someting special about broadcom cards I think , www.ubuntuforums.org
resizing ntfs partitons is pretty safe,  just defrag it a few times before you proceed
in canada , but this isn't the channel for this kind of stuff
it's not difficult the ubuntu isntaller has a guided method to do it
